column2: Celtic paganism is one of the last surviving branch of the ancient druidic belief systems. A pantheon of gods and a world full of spirits, the children of Dannu rule the Skies, the Earth and the Otherworld. The main gods are Cernunnos, the Horned One, Dannu and Nuada, Angus, the god of Youth, Macha, the horse goddess, the great Daghda, Manannan mac Lir, the Sea God and Lugh of the Long Spear.

The reformed Celtic faith has a standardized liturgy etched on the many raised stones on the British Isles, telling the story of the Tuatha De Danann. It is led by the Circle of the Druids with the Arch-Druid as the religious leader of the faithful.
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans\n§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! The Arch Druid is elected by, and from, the members of the Circle
An unwashed, mysterious pagan from the countryside, his powers are unclear, but they serve to appease the more occult worries of a ruler.
The best warrior of the land, the title of champion is a great honor among Celtic peoples, their task is to protect their king.

The Teulu (literally meaning "family") are strongly armed and mounted retainers. Known individually as Uchelwr, these upper class warriors favour red tunics, and dress for battle in a similar style to the Frankish knights, although armed with lances, the Uchelwr's throw javelins.

The vates were one of three classes of Celtic priesthood, the other two being the druids and the bards. The Vates had the role of seers and performed sacrifices (in particular administering human sacrifice) under the presidency of a druid.
The Chariot Master is charged with maintaining the lord's chariots and horses. A position of trust, the honor is only bestowed on warriors, who understand the needs of a charioteer.

The Headsman is charged with the care of the royal family's collection of preserved heads. The actual labor of refilling the jars with juniper oil and replacing damaged vessels is left to servants, they are directed by the Headsman.

The Wardens are responsible for the royal hunting grounds and generally preserving and protecting the wild places from people, and the people from the wild places. The duties of this office are divided into Wards
Your injuries are a sign of weakness, following great Nuada's example, it would be wise to abdicate your throne for the safety of your people.
A serious injury to this ruler's body has made his rule illegitimate in the eyes of his people

The Celts of Gaul were renowned for their excelent cavalry tactics and were often hired on as mercenaries. They even formed the core of the Roman Empire's cavalry regiments for several hundred years. This is where the new breed of Gaulish heavy cavalry are trained.
